greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number T(n,k) of proper multisets of nonempty words with a total of n letters over k-ary alphabet such that all k letters occur at least once in the multiset; triangle T(n,k), n>=2, 1<=k<=n-1, read by rows.
maple: h:= proc(n, i, k) option remember; `if`(n=0, 1, `if`(i<1, 0,
g:= proc(n, k) option remember; `if`(n=0, 1, add(add(
T:= (n, k)-> add((-1)^i*(g(n, k-i)-h(n$2, k-i))*binomial(k, i), i=0..k):
mathematica: Sum[h[n - i*j, i-1, k]*Binomial[k^i, j], {j, 0, n/i}]]];
g[n_, k_] := g[n, k] = If[n == 0, 1, Sum[Sum[
T[n_, k_] := Sum[(-1)^i*(g[n, k-i]-h[n, n, k-i])*Binomial[k, i], {i, 0, k}];
Table[Table[T[n, k], {k, 1, n - 1}], {n, 2, 12}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Feb 13 2021, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Oct 08 2018
